items: Modifier I: CT ischemia test performed via CT-FFR or myocardial CTP.
I+: Lesion-specific ischemia or reversible perfusion defect on CT-FFR/CTP.
I-: CT-FFR/CTP negative for lesion-specific ischemia or reversible ischemia.

rows: 1-2 vessels with mild amount of plaque
1-2 vessels with moderate amount; 3 vessels with mild amount of plaque
3 vessels with moderate amount; 1 vessel with severe amount of plaque
2-3 vessels with severe amount of plaque

items: CAD-RADS 0 denotes absence of stenosis or plaque; P0 is not required.
If plaque burden scores disagree, prefer CAC (Coronary Artery Calcium) or total plaque burden quantification when available.
No single method is mandated; use the technique best suited to your practice.
Patients with prior myocardial infarction and fixed perfusion defects without ischemia on CTP are classified as I-; document prior infarct in the impression.
